snippet: Federal prosecutors said that Eduardo Cornejo, who was fired in January for failing a drug test, essentially held two jobs, working as a police officer during the day and a pimp at night.
abstract: Federal investigators announce former New York City Police Officer Eduardo Cornejo has been charged with transporting women across state lines to engage in prostitution in New York metropolitan area; Cornejo was fired from force in January due to failed drug test; FBI team that tracked Cornejo followed him to Staten Island, Long Island and parts of New Jersey.

byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and AL BAKER

lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors said that Eduardo Cornejo, who was fired in January for failing a drug test, essentially held two jobs, working as a police officer during the day and a pimp at night.

headline.main: New York Officer Ran Prostitution Ring at Motels, Authorities Say
headline.print_headline: Officer Operated a Prostitution Ring at Motels, Federal Prosecutors Say
